intro: Agrostemma infestum, commonly known as the common flaxweed, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Agrostemma infestum is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
